message.content:
cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.AI 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on improving the survivability of Service Function Chains (SFCs) in Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Network Function Virtualization (NFV) environments, which are related to networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The proposed framework for managing SFCs and backup VNFs can be seen as a control system, which falls under the systems and control category. 
3. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper addresses the problem of failure in SFCs, which can lead to security vulnerabilities and breaches. Therefore, it can be categorized under cryptography and security. 
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with large-scale NFV infrastructure deployments, which involve distributed and parallel computing. 
5. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The heuristic algorithms proposed in the paper can be seen as a form of artificial intelligence, which falls under the AI category.
